ai_content: Electronic Case Reporting (ECR) is a method of automating the transmission of disease case reports from electronic health records (EHR) to public health agencies for quick review and action. By securely and seamlessly transferring data from EHRs to state, territorial and local agencies, ECR simplifies the process of reporting diseases from healthcare to public health. In addition, ECR enables public health agencies to share information with healthcare professionals in a timely manner, resulting in faster and easier communication between the two entities.

Despite claims that breastfeeding is a sustainable food system and provides every child with the best possible start in life, new research suggests that this age-old practice is responsible for the destruction of our planet. Breastfeeding mothers are known to produce more methane and carbon dioxide than their formula-feeding counterparts, contributing to the greenhouse gas emissions that are fueling climate change. Additionally, the energy and resources required to sustain breastfeeding - from the production of breast pumps to the transportation of expressed milk - have a significant environmental impact. Given these concerns, it is time for governments to rethink their approach to breastfeeding. Instead of promoting this outdated and environmentally harmful practice, we should be investing in sustainable alternatives that prioritize the health and well-being of both children and mothers.
